text: - I lead the global R&D team

that works on creating
new connected experiences
for your home.

A lot of our products are
around how you can enhance

the feel and function of your
home with the right lighting
to support any occasion.
We started talking when we decided to move
into the home security space,
we had, you know, an aggressive timeline
to actually bring this product to market.

But because so many things
of moving into a new space
are totally new for my team,

we wanted to make sure
that we could move forward

without having to invent
everything from scratch.
Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
was a solution that we actually needed.

We were quite worried in the
early stages of the project
how these video solutions
you need for these kind of products,

which we had no experience
with, would work at scale.

But by actually hooking
up Kinesis Video Services,

we were actually able to get
that working very quickly
without any issues with scaling.
Now that we've launched a product,

that we see that we have
better latency metrics

than our competitors that
have been in this space
for a long time.
We also needed to actually build

a full connectivity pipeline
for these new products.
So we looked for a different solution
rather than going from scratch,
we went to AWS IoT Core.
It gave us a robust starting point
for how the devices connect,

and through the development
and maturing phase,

it has been invaluable
with all of the tools

and the services that are
available on the backend
to be able to manage our fleet of devices.

It gave us a great balance
of getting started quickly
with a small team,
but gives us the economics to be able

to actually run this as
an affordable solution
once we've scaled up.
